00005 #define splmEV (ev.isDisabled()||!debug) ? ev : ev << "PhyLayer(SimplePathlossModel): "

00007 SimplePathlossConstMapping::SimplePathlossConstMapping(const DimensionSet& dimensions,
00008                                                        SimplePathlossModel* model,
00009                                                        const double distFactor)
00010   : SimpleConstMapping(dimensions)
00011   , distFactor(distFactor)
00012   , model(model)
00013   , hasFrequency(dimensions.hasDimension(Dimension::frequency))
00014 { }
00015 
00016 SimplePathlossConstMapping::SimplePathlossConstMapping(const SimplePathlossConstMapping& o)
00017   : SimpleConstMapping(o)
00018   , distFactor(o.distFactor)
00019   , model(o.model)
00020   , hasFrequency(o.hasFrequency)
00021 { }
00022 
00023 double SimplePathlossConstMapping::getValue(const Argument& pos) const
00024 {
00025   double freq = model->carrierFrequency;
00026   if(hasFrequency) {
00027     assert(pos.hasArgVal(Dimension::frequency));
00028     freq = pos.getArgValue(Dimension::frequency);
00029   }
00030   double wavelength = BaseWorldUtility::speedOfLight / freq;
00031   return (wavelength * wavelength) * distFactor;
00032 }

00035 
00036 void SimplePathlossModel::filterSignal(AirFrame *frame, const Coord& sendersPos, const Coord& receiverPos)
00037 {
00038   Signal& signal = frame->getSignal();
00039 
00041   double sqrDistance = useTorus ? receiverPos.sqrTorusDist(sendersPos, playgroundSize)
00042                   : receiverPos.sqrdist(sendersPos);
00043 
00044   splmEV << "sqrdistance is: " << sqrDistance << endl;
00045 
00046   if(sqrDistance <= 1.0) {
00047     //attenuation is negligible
00048     return;
00049   }
00050 
00051   // wavelength in meters (this is only used for debug purposes here
00052   // the actual effect of the wavelength on the attenuation is
00053   // calculated in SimplePathlossConstMappings "getValue()" method).
00054   double wavelength = (BaseWorldUtility::speedOfLight/carrierFrequency);
00055   splmEV << "wavelength is: " << wavelength << endl;
00056 
00057   // the part of the attenuation only depending on the distance
00058   double distFactor = pow(sqrDistance, -pathLossAlphaHalf) / (16.0 * M_PI * M_PI);
00059   splmEV << "distance factor is: " << distFactor << endl;
00060 
00061   //is our signal to attenuate defined over frequency?
00062   bool hasFrequency = signal.getTransmissionPower()->getDimensionSet().hasDimension(Dimension::frequency);
00063   splmEV << "Signal contains frequency dimension: " << (hasFrequency ? "yes" : "no") << endl;
00064 
00065   const DimensionSet& domain = hasFrequency ? DimensionSet::timeFreqDomain : DimensionSet::timeDomain;
00066 
00067   //create the Attenuation mapping which takes the distance factor as parameter
00068   //to calculate the attenuation from this and the frequency used for the transmission
00069   //see the classes "getValue()" for more
00070   SimplePathlossConstMapping* attMapping = new SimplePathlossConstMapping(
00071                           domain,
00072                           this,
00073                           distFactor);
00074 
00075   /* at last add the created attenuation mapping to the signal */
00076   signal.addAttenuation(attMapping);
00077 }
00078 
00079 double SimplePathlossModel::calcPathloss(const Coord& receiverPos, const Coord& sendersPos)
00080 {
00081   /*
00082    * maybe we can reuse an already calculated value for the square-distance
00083    * at this point.
00084    *
00085    */
00086   double sqrdistance = 0.0;
00087 
00088   if (useTorus)
00089   {
00090     sqrdistance = receiverPos.sqrTorusDist(sendersPos, playgroundSize);
00091   } else
00092   {
00093     sqrdistance = receiverPos.sqrdist(sendersPos);
00094   }
00095 
00096   splmEV << "sqrdistance is: " << sqrdistance << endl;
00097 
00098   double attenuation = 1.0;
00099   // wavelength in metres
00100   double wavelength = (BaseWorldUtility::speedOfLight/carrierFrequency);
00101 
00102   splmEV << "wavelength is: " << wavelength << endl;
00103 
00104   if (sqrdistance > 1.0)
00105   {
00106     attenuation = (wavelength * wavelength) / (16.0 * M_PI * M_PI)
00107             * (pow(sqrdistance, -1.0*pathLossAlphaHalf));
00108   }
00109 
00110   splmEV << "attenuation is: " << attenuation << endl;
00111 
00112   return attenuation;
00113 }
